question_content.barrons:question: There is an essential __________ in human gestures, and when someone raises the palms of his hands together, we do not know whether it is to bury himself in prayer or to throw himself into the sea.
question_content.barrons:explanation:
ambiguity; uncertainty.

The statement that we do not know whether a gesture indicates devotion or despair suggests that gestures are by their nature ambiguous (unclear) or uncertain.

Economy is incorrect. Nothing in the context suggests that there is any particular economy (efficiency or restraint in use) in human gestures.

Dignity is incorrect. Nothing in the context suggests that there is an essential dignity (formal bearing; nobility of character) in human gestures.

Insincerity is incorrect. Even though we do not know whether a gesture indicates devotion or despair, the context does not suggest that there is an essential insincerity (intentional deceitfulness) in human gestures.

Reverence is incorrect. Nothing in the context suggests that there is an essential reverence (deep respect; awe) in human gestures.
